summary: This document is a prison administrative record from FCI Estill detailing Jeffrey Epstein's schedule and mental health status on July 31 and August 1, 2019. It notes he was taken off suicide watch after a Suicide Risk Assessment found him psychologically stable, following an earlier note indicating suicidal tendencies after a court appearance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose schedule and mental health status are being documented. He returned from court with a note indicating suicidal tendencies, prompting a Suicide Risk Assessment.

persons.name: Associate Warden (O) FCI Estill
persons.context: The official whose title and prison address are listed at the bottom of the document, likely the author or responsible administrator.

connections.description: Epstein is an inmate under the custody and supervision of the Associate Warden at FCI Estill.

events.title: Epstein's Court Appearance and Initial Note
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a court appearance from 9:30-11:30 am. He returned from court with a note indicating suicidal tendencies.

events.title: Attorney Conference and Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Epstein had an attorney conference beginning at 9:00 am. A Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) was conducted, with findings indicating he is psychologically stable. He was subsequently taken off suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Taken Off Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off suicide watch ('psych ops') on July 31, 2019. He was seen by a psychologist the next day as standard practice.

locations.name: FCI Estill
locations.context: The federal correctional institution where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The full address is provided: 100 Prison Road, Estill, SC 29918.

keyFacts: On July 31, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein returned from a court appearance with a note indicating suicidal tendencies.
A Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) was subsequently conducted, and its findings indicated Epstein was 'psychologically stable.'
Based on the SRA, Epstein was taken off suicide watch ('psych ops') on July 31, 2019.
The document records Epstein's schedule, including a court appearance on July 31 and an attorney conference on August 1, 2019.
The document originates from the Associate Warden at FCI Estill, the prison where Epstein was held.
